subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{zh-ref|Zhengzhang (2003)}}: {{Han compound|彊|虫|c1=p|c2=s|t2=insect|ls=psc}}.

''{{w|Shuowen}}'': {{Han compound|弘|虫|c1=p|c2=s|t2=insect|ls=psc}}.

The character {{lang|zh|強}} likely originally referred to the [[rice weevil]], an [[insect]] that attacks [[rice]] and several other crops, before being phonetically borrowed to represent the sense of "strong; powerful", which was previously represented by the character {{och-l|彊}}.

subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[strong]]; [[powerful]]; [[energetic]]

# [[staunch]]; [[strong-willed]]

#: {{zh-x|強-拖 乘客 下機|to '''forcefully''' drag a passenger off the plane}}

# [[final]] [[contestant]]s in a [[competition]]; [[finalist]]
# {{lb|zh|Teochew}} [[clever]]
# {{lb|zh|Teochew}} [[good]] at
